thread.title: Paris Saint-Germain reveal bizarre training drill ahead of Barcelona Champions League clash
thread.title_full: Paris Saint-Germain reveal bizarre training drill ahead of Barcelona Champions League clash

author: Thomas Bristow
title: Paris Saint-Germain reveal bizarre training drill ahead of Barcelona Champions League clash
text:
Get FC Barcelona updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Paris Saint-Germain take on Barcelona in a huge last 16 Champions League clash on Wednesday night - and have revealed some bizarre preparation techniques. 
The Ligue 1 champions finished second in their group behind Arsenal, and as a result were drawn against Group C winners, Barcelona. 
The two clubs have faced each other six times in the past four years, twice in the quarter-finals of the European competition. 
The record stands at two wins a piece and two draws. "Ready?" (Photo: FOOTBALL PASSION/Youtube) 
And in order to try and take that record by the horns, PSG have crafted a rather unique training drill. 
Les Parisiens look as though they've mixed Bayern Munich's favourite training drill (El Rondo) with the hokey cokey. "Wooaaaah the hokey cokey..." (Photo: FOOTBALL PASSION/Youtube) 
Choosing three players to go in the middle, the rest of the squad essentially play piggy in the middle while holding hands. 
The drill not only forces you to think quickly but also be accurate with your passing. 
Will it make a difference against the mighty Barca? Like us on Facebook
